author: Jennifer Soltys
title: Your Ultimate Guide to Moving Homes: Tips for a Hassle-Free Move
text:
Moving can be one of life’s most stressful experiences, but it doesn’t have to be overwhelming. With the right strategies and support, you can transition to your new residence smoothly.
While many people attempt to manage the entire process alone, partnering with skilled services can make a significant difference. Taking the time to get ready and use resources effectively allows you to avoid common pitfalls, reduce anxiety, and focus on the excitement of starting fresh.
Let’s explore the key steps to making your move as efficient and stress-free as possible.
Source
Here’s what you need to know: Start Planning Early Getting started early is essential for minimizing stress and avoiding last-minute complications. Begin creating a detailed timeline outlining every task, from securing your new residence to transferring utilities.
A comprehensive checklist can keep you on track and make sure no detail is overlooked. Break your workload into manageable steps to make the process less daunting. Allocate specific days to focus on tasks like notifying service providers, decluttering, or gathering supplies.
Early preparation also allows you to research potential moving services, compare options, and book the ones that best suit your needs. Planning in advance gives you time to address unexpected challenges without feeling rushed, setting a solid foundation for an organized move.
Choose the Right Moving Partner The process of relocating becomes significantly more manageable when you work with experienced professionals. Opting for a full-service moving company provides various benefits, including assistance with packing, loading, transportation, and even unpacking.
These companies often specialize in handling fragile, oversized, or high-value items, making sure that they arrive safely at your new location. Full-service providers can customize their offerings to suit your specific requirements, whether you’re relocating a small apartment or a large household.
Their expertise eliminates much of the guesswork, allowing you to focus on settling into your new environment. By entrusting key aspects of your move to professionals, you can save time and reduce stress while making sure that your belongings are treated with care.
Declutter Before Packing Decluttering before packing is one of the most effective ways to streamline your move. Start by going through each room to find items you no longer need or use. Sort your stuff into categories: keep, donate, recycle, or discard. Donating gently used items to local charities is environmentally friendly and benefits your community.
Hosting a yard sale can help you earn extra cash to offset moving expenses. Removing unnecessary items reduces the amount of belongings to be moved, lowering costs and simplifying unpacking later.
Decluttering also allows you to reflect on what truly matters, allowing you to create a fresh and organized start in your new space.
Gather Packing Supplies Getting the right supplies is essential to protect your belongings and make the packing process more efficient . Stock up on high-quality boxes, packing tape, bubble wrap, and labels to securely pack your items. Look for eco-friendly options such as recycled materials or reusable crates to minimize environmental impact.
Buying supplies in bulk can save you both time and money while making sure you have enough for the entire process. Don’t forget to include specialty items like wardrobe boxes for clothing or dish-specific boxes for fragile kitchenware.
Keep tools like markers, scissors, and box cutters easily accessible to streamline your work. Proper preparation with the right materials can prevent damage and make unpacking easier.
Label and Organize Boxes Effective labeling and organization are critical for a hassle-free moving experience. Clearly label each box with its contents and the room it belongs to, making it easier to find items when unpacking. Using an inventory list helps you track all your things and makes sure nothing gets lost during the move.
Consider color-coding your labels or using stickers to visually differentiate boxes for each room. Numbering boxes and keeping a corresponding checklist can add an extra layer of organization.
Group similar items together to avoid mixing things from different rooms, which can create confusion. By taking these simple steps, you’ll save time and effort when setting up your new space, making the transition smoother and more efficient.
Pack an Essentials Box Packing an essentials box is a lifesaver during a hectic relocation. This box should contain all the items you’ll need for the first 24 to 48 hours in your new home. Include toiletries, a change of clothes, chargers for electronic devices, and basic kitchen supplies like plates, cups, and utensils.
If you have children or pets, make sure to include their essentials, such as snacks, toys, or bedding. Keep important documents, medications, and any small valuables in this box to make sure they’re easily accessible. Label the box clearly and keep it with you during the move rather than loading it onto the moving truck.
Having these necessities on hand will help you settle in more comfortably while unpacking the rest of your things.
Notify Important Parties It’s easy to forget to notify the right people and organizations about your move, but it’s a crucial step. Begin by updating your address with the postal service to make sure all mail is forwarded to your new residence.
Contact utility providers to schedule disconnections at your old home and connections at the new one. Inform financial institutions, insurance companies, and healthcare providers about your updated contact details. Schools and employers should also be notified, especially if you’re relocating to a new area.
Don’t forget to transfer or cancel memberships, such as gym subscriptions or local clubs. By keeping everyone informed, you’ll avoid interruptions in service and make sure there’s a seamless transition to your new address.
Plan for Moving Day The actual moving day can be chaotic without proper preparation, so it’s important to stay organized. Start by confirming the schedule with your moving company and having a backup plan in case of unexpected delays.
Pack a cooler with water, snacks , and easy-to-eat meals to keep everyone energized throughout the day. Assign specific roles to family members or friends who are helping, such as overseeing the movers or keeping an eye on children and pets.
Keep cleaning supplies on hand to tidy up your old home before leaving. Double-check that all items have been loaded before the moving truck leaves. With careful coordination, you can keep moving day running smoothly and avoid unnecessary stress.
Relocating to a new home can be a challenging yet rewarding experience. By planning ahead, decluttering, and using reliable services, you can significantly reduce the stress associated with moving.
Each step, from labeling boxes to notifying important parties, plays a vital role in ensuring a seamless transition. Remember to pack an essentials box and prioritize safety to keep the process as smooth as possible.
With the right mindset and prep work, you can transform the moving process into a manageable and even exciting milestone in your life.

author: Amy Ash Nixon nixona@caledonian-record.com Staff Writer
title: New Year’s Wishes: Health, Happiness - And An End To War | Local News | caledonianrecord.com
text: ST. JOHNSBURY - Wishes for the coming New Year shared with The Caledonian-Record span from the global spectrum. From wishes to be cancer-free to an end of war. People shared their hopes and wishes with me as I strolled around downtown St. Johnsbury the day after Christmas, and also responded to an online question posted for readers in the North Country of New Hampshire and Northeast Kingdom of Vermont for our annual New Year’s Eve poll. kAm• kDEC@?8mr@==66? r@=6k^DEC@?8m @7 |@C82? author: 责任编辑：龙慧
title: 古树医生和千岁"患者"：8年来广东古树医生团队抢救复壮古树名木超200棵 - 新闻频道 - 中山网
text:
惊蛰一过，万物复苏。
清远市佛冈县迳头镇井冈村委会柯木冈村，3棵处于修复期的古樟树迎来“体检复诊”。负责这项工作的是广东省林业科学研究院森林保护研究所副所长黄华毅，他也被大家称为古树医生。
“看，樟果上长满了黄褐色的瘤状物，这是樟树粉实病。”黄华毅对团队成员说，病果要尽可能全部剪除，再喷药防治。
这一幕是黄华毅的工作日常。8年来，黄华毅所在团队在全省各地诊疗的古树名木已达200多棵，很多古树树龄超千年。
植树节后，《古树名木保护条例》将正式施行，古树名木的分级分类、日常养护、采伐限制、传承文化等具体规定将陆续落地。
“条例实施后，我们期待更多人参与其中，共同保护珍贵的古树名木。”黄华毅说。
用“内窥镜”防治白蚁
去年9月，柯木冈村3棵古樟树顶梢异常干枯，当地邀请黄华毅团队来作全面检查。诊断结果显示，其主要原因是冠层地面的硬体化铺装，影响了根系的透气透水，正常生长受阻。
在团队建议下，当地拆除了水泥树池。到今年开春，村民发现3棵古树新芽生长较往年旺盛不少，但同时也发现部分嫩梢有叶片稀少的问题。
“水泥拆了也不灵？”“不会治坏了吧？”大家犯起嘀咕，猜测不断。
黄华毅前来复诊，一眼就发现了问题。
“这次是樟树粉实病严重发生引起的。”黄华毅告诉记者，“病果要尽量剪除以减少对树体营养的竞争和侵染源，再喷药防治。”
除了粉实病，白蚁危害也很常见。在与白蚁的一次次“攻防”中，古树的诊断技术也在不断创新和迭代。
“开始我们用树木‘听诊器’，通过昆虫啃食的声音判断危害情况；后来使用树木‘彩超’，用应力波仪器探测树木空洞。”黄华毅说，但这些手段无法直观了解虫情，探到空洞后还要掰开朽木查看。
为更有效控制蚁患，黄华毅和团队最近发现车用探伤仪的探头可以伸进树洞深处获取影像，相当于树用“内窥镜”。在传回的画面里，树木空洞中是否有白蚁，蚁害、树体腐败程度如何都能直接看到。杀灭白蚁也从粗放的灌药撒药迭代为监测、趋避、诱杀等多元化结合措施。
黄华毅边说边拿起给药滴管伸进蚁道中，将混合饵剂的茚虫威喷在白蚁身上。“利用白蚁互相舔食的习性，药物可以通过工蚁直达蚁巢最深处，同时不让白蚁受惊分巢。”他说。
一系列古树诊疗技术经团队5年时间的整理调整，最终成为省《古树名木抢救复壮技术规程》的主要部分。这也是广东首个省级古树名木保护领域的地方标准，将于今年5月13日起正式实施。
用试剂盒监测褐根病
医树如医人。黄华毅的工作中，有“门诊”的熟练，也有面对急症绝症的紧张与无奈。
2024年的一天，黄华毅接到一个陌生电话。
“村里的假苹婆古树几周前还好好的，突然就黄了，还倒下了！”电话那头，一个男子着急地说道。
假苹婆是华南地区最有代表性的树种之一，在登记古树中并不多见。放下电话，黄华毅立即赶赴现场。
面对翻倒的古树，黄华毅一边安慰村民，一边在古树根部蹲下，一掰一捏，树根竟成一撮齑粉。“果然是褐根病，病原菌在土中繁殖，感染破坏树木根系……这里有明显的标志。”黄华毅指着深褐色的病灶说，“但病灶蔓延到土外就晚了，大多数古树在几个月内就枯萎了。”
“要治愈此病，往常做法只有超大剂量灌药，杀灭土壤真菌，同时为古树剪除病根，细如毛发的末梢也不能放过。”黄华毅说，“放眼整个华南地区，已知的治愈病例寥寥无几。”
褐根病能否提早发现甚至预防？一个小物件给黄华毅提供了灵感：核酸检测试剂盒……经过在一系列的研发工作，目前利用试剂盒检测，都能如期出现“两条杠”。这意味着，褐根病的发现和预防有望被普及，而不再需要依赖“实地检查”。
据悉，该科研进展已受到国家林草局关注。此外，黄华毅团队还同步开展生物防治攻关，如今已取得进展——在黄华毅展示的培养皿中，生物制剂胶体已经显著抑制病原菌丝的发展，“攻克‘绝症’，我们又向前迈了一步。”
帮助全国各地更多古树诊治
随着名声与诊疗技术的增长，向“树医”求助者也日益增多。今年刚开春，黄华毅就收到了澳门的再次邀请。两年前，团队受邀赴澳门开展工作，一批古树因此受益。
比如，在发现一棵细叶榕名木的树体空洞后，当地立刻作了细致的修补，但囿于修补工艺，填补的部分逢雨易漏，潮气的侵蚀，让树体内腐烂的创面越来越大。
此时，黄华毅带来的新填补材料派上了用场。“在肇庆怀集‘红锥王’上，我们也用到了这种材料。”黄华毅说。当时，1400多岁的红锥王也面临树干空洞、侧枝过长等问题。为帮其恢复，团队应用了新修补材料，并对侧枝修剪后留下的大创面采取涂药、包覆等综合措施，还起到了修旧如旧的效果。
此外，澳门的多株古树名木还面临修枝后创面过大、白蚁侵害、日灼缺水等问题，黄华毅也一一对症下药，提供解决方案。
8年弹指一挥间。随着团队诊疗“工具箱”的完善，团队人员扩充到现在的24人，团队经手救护的古树名木也已超200棵。
阳春三月的一个寻常日子，黄华毅的微信再次急促响起。
“黄老师，还记得你在罗浮山救治的那棵龙眼古树吗？它开花了！今年应该会结很多果！”消息来自罗浮山黄龙观的工作人员，“等到果熟时，你一定要来尝尝，这是它给你的谢礼。”
◆编辑：龙慧◆二审：陈吉春◆三审：周亚平

author: Estadão Conteudo
title: Oscar destaca boa fase e mira a Copa Libertadores pelo São Paulo: 'Sei como é importante'
text:
Recém-contratado pelo São Paulo, o meia Oscar falou pela primeira vez após o retorno ao clube e mostrou estar em sintonia com a torcida. O jogador de 33 anos se mostrou empolgado com o retorno ao clube e destacou a importância de fazer uma boa campanha na próxima edição da Copa Libertadores.
“Sei o quanto é importante a Libertadores para o São Paulo. Espero que o nosso time possa fazer um bom campeonato e chegar o mais longe possível. Precisamos começar o ano bem para chegar forte na Libertadores”, comentou Oscar em entrevista ao SPFC Play, canal oficial do clube.
O reforço, que deve usar a camisa 8, assinou um contrato de três anos com a agremiação do Morumbi depois de oito temporadas no futebol chinês. O jogador afirmou que atravessa um dos melhores momentos de sua carreira e, assim, espera contribuir para que o São Paulo aumente o número de troféus em sua galeria.
“Estou em uma fase muito boa, tanto tecnicamente quanto fisicamente. O último ano foi um dos meus melhores em Xangai, tive mais de 30 assistências, fiz mais de 15 gols”, afirmou o meia, que defendia o Shanghai Port no futebol asiático. “Espero ajudar o clube o máximo que eu puder a conquistar grandes títulos.”
Oscar ainda lembrou da convivência com Lucas Moura nas categorias de base do time tricolor e o contato recente com o amigo, que demonstrou satisfação em reeditar a parceria no próximo ano.
“O Lucas me mandou mensagem, queria saber se ia dar certo ou não. Também tem o Luiz Gustavo, com quem joguei na seleção brasileira. Então, são várias pessoas que já jogaram comigo e ficaram felizes que eu estou voltando para o São Paulo. Espero fazer uma boa dupla com o Lucas, já fizemos na base e eu espero agora retribuir também no profissional”, disse.
O jogador também demonstrou que não ficaram mágoas após uma saída conturbada do clube para o Internacional há 14 anos. Ele disse ter recebido apoio dos torcedores são-paulinos, o que foi fundamental para que optasse por retornar ao futebol brasileiro.
“Tenho muito carinho pelo torcedor, por mais que eu tenha jogado muito pouco no profissional. Agora, na minha volta, o carinho foi maior, onde eu ia todo mundo falava: ‘Volta, por favor’. Isso para mim e para a minha família foi muito especial. Que bom que deu certo”, comentou Oscar, que já passou por exames médicos e se apresentará para a pré-temporada em janeiro, antes da viagem para os Estados Unidos.
